title: Why is Eddie Van Halen considered one of the rock legends? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why wouldn’t he be? Literally, every guitarist who came after ’80s were copying him. Well, he might not be the only best guitarist or most talented out there. But he was the most mainstream guitarist of ‘80s. He was the next Hendrix. He extended what Hendrix had started. Although there is an overlooked guitarist. Its Ritchie Blackmore.[1] EVH, was a big booster to rock guitar. A big part of guitar shredding came through him. Even Randy Rhoads was inspired by him.[2] Besides, EVH was also a very good keyboardist. As far as I know he even won the piano competition in his school. So, I don’t see any reason for not being EVH a legend. Although one of the worst things of him was getting involved in glam rock/metal. Which was very annoying. Nevertheless it wouldn’t make him a bad guitarist. Footnotes[1] Ritchie Blackmore: The Link Between Hendrix and Van Halen[2] Eddie Van Halen & Randy Rhoads: Duelling Guitarists

Absolutely…He was an innovative force and changed the direction of rock music at that moment in time…He came in on a level above most guitar stingers from the very http://start….It was his style and dexterity that was different…And it immediately changed the direction of that genre of rock…I got to handle one of his guitars once and was astonished to note that the action ( height) of his strings ( from the fretboard) was incredibly high…It might have been a anomaly, I'm sure its noted in the hundreds of guitar mags, but here's the deal…He had incredible strength in his forearms like Popeye…So do Stevie Ray Vaughn and Steve Morse….This gives a player a great advantage that most folks don't realize….Stevie was able the mount Bass frets on his guitars and it gave him a much heavier Strat signature sound than most…Eric Clapton said that he felt inadequate when playing next to SRV…Steve Morse is one of the best slingers the world has ever seen….Melding rock, symphonic,jazz, and chicken picking at lightning speed…Dude from Dream Theater is a student of Morse, but Morse did it in 73 with the Dixie Dregs….So, innovation and opening doors to others makes a musican a genius in my book…Ironically, I never was a fan of Van Halen..lol
